metadata.Title: CVE-2020-16124 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer Overflow or Wraparound vulnerability in the XML RPC library of OpenRobotics ros_comm communications packages allows unauthenticated network traffic to cause unexpected behavior. This issue affects: OpenRobotics ros_comm communications packages Noetic and prior versions. Fixed in https://github.com/ros/ros_comm/pull/2065.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-16124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

cl-roscpp-msg - 1.15.14+ds-4
cl-topic-tools - 1.15.14+ds-4
libmessage-filters1d - 1.15.14+ds-4
librosbag-storage4d - 1.15.14+ds-4
librosbag4d - 1.15.14+ds-4
libroscpp4d - 1.15.14+ds-4
libroslz4-1d - 1.15.14+ds-4
libtopic-tools2d - 1.15.14+ds-4
libxmlrpcpp3d - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-message-filters - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosbag - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-roscpp-msg - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosgraph - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-roslaunch - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-roslz4 - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosmaster - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosmsg - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosnode - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosparam - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rospy - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rosservice - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rostest - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-rostopic - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-roswtf - 1.15.14+ds-4
python3-topic-tools - 1.15.14+ds-4
ros-roscpp-msg - 1.15.14+ds-4
ros-topic-tools-srvs - 1.15.14+ds-4
rosout - 1.15.14+ds-4
topic-tools - 1.15.14+ds-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ros-ros-comm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.15.14+ds-4').
